text: Topsy and Tim were going to the zoo

she asked one would you like to come

they went to see the friendly elephant

pet animals were just as interesting and

I don't know why we go to the zoo said

and Tim learn to swim

took him to the swimming pool nearly
every day mommy helped them to put on

never run near the pool he said the

mommy did get splashed stretch your legs

well done Topsy said mommy you can

he told Tim to Bob right down until the

look at me he gasped I was swimming and
he really was
mummy helped me to get dressed and dry
their hair won't dad be surprised when
we tell him we can swim without our arm
bad said Tim dad was waiting for them in
the snack bar dad we can swim cried
Topsy dad was pleased he pointed to a

you can swim in the beginners race Topsy
and Tim the next week dad and mummy and
top sent him went to the big pool for
the swimming competition there were
short races there were long races there
was a race for children swimming on
their backs last of all there was the

blew his whistle to start the
race Topsy swam dog-paddle as fast as
she could Tim was left behind but he
knew what to do he bobbed right down in

he paddled hard with his hands and feet
everyone cheered as the children swam
slowly across the pool Topsy and Tim
didn't win the race but everyone got a
beginner's badge because they had all
reached the other side so we find out
what happens when Topsy and Tim go
camping Topsy and Tim were going can't
be with mummy and dad they were taking
two tents a big one for mummy and dad
and a small one for Topsy and Tim it was
a long drive but at last they arrived at
the campsite it was in a field beside a
little wood Topsy and Tim helped to
unload the car putting the tents up was
a puzzle at first but Topsy and Tim soon
remembered how to do it I like our tent
best said Topsy Tim went to fetch water
he was surprised to find a tap in the
field it was a very splashy tap there
was hot soup for supper and sandwiches
and big red apples after supper Topsy
and Tim went with mummy and dad to
explore the wood somebody's been
painting arrows on the tree said Tim
look yes said mummy if we follow those
arrows they will take us for a good walk
and bring us back to camp and they got

Tim it's time you two got into your

were all Moses

boys will come too
said Topsy and Tim they had a wonderful
time in the wood they swung from trees
like monkeys on the king of the jungle

trying to catch them but the rabbits ran
faster I nearly caught one puff Topsy
but it ran down a rabbit hole
at last they began to feel hungry none

know which way to go we're lost said one

the arrows of the trees will lead us
back to camp mommy said so mommy and dad
were glad to see them I was just coming
to find you said dad what have you been

Topsy and Tim were ready for breakfast
mommy could not get the camp stove to

to see what was wrong come and join us
he said there's plenty of room on the
barbeque yes love barbecue soon there
was the lovely smell of sausages and

and there was plenty for everyone
I love camping said Tim I wish we could
stay here forever said Topsy Topsy and
Tim helped a friend
one morning Topsy and Tim met Stevie
Dunton at the school gate
Stevie looked upset What's Wrong Stevie
asked him I hate school said Stevie
Stevie cheered up when they went into
the classroom but it break he didn't
want to go out to play what's wrong
Stevie asked miss Terri
nothing said Stevie and he went outside
Topsy and Tim were playing it in the

Harry was it Stevie joined in and Carey

runner he was getting away from Carey
when James the biggest boy in the class
stuck out his foot and trips TV up
Stevie began to cry cry baby cry baby

didn't but they didn't know what to do
after break it was PE the children had

everyone was ready except Stevie come on
Stevie we're waiting for you said Miss
Terry I can't find one of my plimsolls
at Stevie Fair it is said Topsy pointing

said Stevie Tim saw sylvie wink at James
after school Topsy and Tim told mummy

Silva copies him said Tim I think Sylvia

what's a bully ask Topsy it's someone

afraid to tell a grown-up it was very

catch sylvie he shouted that's not yours

everyone laughed except Topsy and Tim

we had a class chat when all the

hit and they hurt you said Andy Anderson
they call you names said RIE they make
your friends be nasty to you said Louise
they think it's funny and they don't
always know they're hurting your

unkind said Topsy sometimes bullies have

then they take it out on someone else
because it makes them feel big Topsy and
Tim began to feel sorry for the bullies
I hate bullying said Carrie does anyone

shouted all the children at lunch Miss
Terry James Sylvie and
Divi Dunton sat down to have a chat I'm

looking upset me too said Sylvie we

me but let's be friends instead everyone
played it together soon it was time to

after school Topsy and Tim and Stevie

see you tomorrow

next Topsy put her hands into the bucket

it snows were both in the warm milk then
